title: SHM frequency - cylinder and 3 springs in series

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.Three springs, Spring <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, Spring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and Spring <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, have different spring constants <math alttext="k sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="k sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="k sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, respectively, where <math alttext="k sub 3 is greater than k sub 2, which is greater than k sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The springs are connected in series and hung vertically. A cylinder of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is then hung from the series of springs and allowed to oscillate up and down. In this configuration, the cylinder oscillates with a frequency of <math alttext="f sub 1 2 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>123</mn></msub></math>.If the cylinder were hung from only Spring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and allowed to oscillate, it would oscillate with a frequency <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.(a) Indicate whether <math alttext="f sub 1 2 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>123</mn></msub></math> is greater than, less than, or equal to <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Justify your answer without referencing or manipulating equations.

frqParts.text: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.Three springs, Spring <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, Spring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and Spring <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, have different spring constants <math alttext="k sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="k sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="k sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, respectively, where <math alttext="k sub 3 is greater than k sub 2, which is greater than k sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The springs are connected in series and hung vertically. A cylinder of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is then hung from the series of springs and allowed to oscillate up and down. In this configuration, the cylinder oscillates with a frequency of <math alttext="f sub 1 2 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>123</mn></msub></math>.If the cylinder were hung from only Spring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and allowed to oscillate, it would oscillate with a frequency <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.(a) Indicate whether <math alttext="f sub 1 2 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>123</mn></msub></math> is greater than, less than, or equal to <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Justify your answer without referencing or manipulating equations.

It is determined that the spring constants are related as follows: <math alttext="2 times k sub 1, equals k sub 2, which equals the fraction with numerator k sub 3, and denominator 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>.(b) Derive an expression for the oscillation frequency <math alttext="f sub 1 2 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>123</mn></msub></math> of the cylinder-three springs system. Express your answer in terms of <math alttext="k sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate.

(c) If a cylinder of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math> were hung vertically from Spring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> only and allowed to oscillate, indicate whether the oscillation frequency would be greater than, less than, or the same as the frequency you derived in part (b). Justify your answer.

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
